intro: Pentanisia prunelloides subsp. prunelloides, commonly known as the Prunelloides pentanisia, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a shrub characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink, which bloom in the spring. Its fruits are small berries that turn red when mature, attracting various bird species. This subspecies is native to parts of Central America and is often found in moist, shaded habitats.
